title: Every good PowerShell module has a module manifest. The module manifest simply contains metadata about a PowerShell module, and doesn’t define the actual contents of the module.

inline_content.Text: Every good PowerShell module has a module manifest. The module manifest simply contains metadata about a PowerShell module, and doesn’t define the actual contents of the module.

title: The manifest file is a PowerShell script file, with a
.psd1
c
file extension, that contains a HashTable. The HashTable in the manifest must contain specific keys, in order for PowerShell to correctly interpret it as a PowerShell module file.

inline_content.Text: The manifest file is a PowerShell script file, with a
file extension, that contains a HashTable. The HashTable in the manifest must contain specific keys, in order for PowerShell to correctly interpret it as a PowerShell module file.

title: The example above provides a list of the core HashTable keys that make up a module manifest, but there are many others. The
New-ModuleManifest
c
command helps you create a new module manifest skeleton.

inline_content.Text: The example above provides a list of the core HashTable keys that make up a module manifest, but there are many others. The
command helps you create a new module manifest skeleton.
